channel.title: BBC News - Middle East

item.title: UK and Iran summon diplomats after tanker attack
item.description: Two people were killed in the attack on an oil tanker, which the UK, US and Israel blame on Iran.

item.title: Sheikh Jarrah: Palestinians and Israelis baulk at evictions compromise
item.description: A plan to end a long-running saga which has fuelled Israel-Palestinian tensions faces rejection.

item.title: Tanker attack: UK and US blame Iran for deadly ship attack
item.description: The UK accuses Tehran of violating international law, while Iran calls the accusations "baseless".

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: 'Can we have two golds?' - high jumpers share win
item.description: An incredible Olympic high jump final ended with both Qatar's Mutaz Essa Barshim and Italy's Gianmarco Tamberi taking gold medals.

item.title: Coronavirus: Israel to give third jab to people aged over 60
item.description: Israel will offer Covid boosters amid a recent surge in infections.

item.title: Israel investigating shooting of Palestinian boy in West Bank
item.description: Palestinian officials say soldiers shot the 12-year-old as he travelled in a car in the West Bank.

item.title: Lebanonâ€™s descent into darkness
item.description: The country's economic crisis has forced some families to move into refugee camps to survive.

item.title: Sweden charges man over 1988 Iran prison massacre
item.description: Hamid Nouri faces trial over the mass execution of detainees during the Iran-Iraq war.

item.title: Israel-Gaza conflict: Apparent war crimes committed, says rights group
item.description: Human Rights Watch accuses Israel and Palestinian militants of unlawful attacks in May's conflict.

item.title: West faces dilemmas over tanker attack
item.description: A drone attack on a ship off the coast of Oman has worsened already strained ties with Iran.

item.title: Iran water: What's causing the shortages?
item.description: Iranian officials have warned of historic drought while experts blame years of poor water management.

item.title: Gaza photographer hopes digital art boom can help raise aid money
item.description: A Palestinian photographer wants to help children by selling an image from May's conflict.

item.title: How US military pullback in Iraq could benefit Iran
item.description: The withdrawal of remaining US combat troops could help Iran achieve its ambitions.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: Egypt's Sherif to 'play with heart' in historic medal bid
item.description: Mayar Sherif will play 'with her heart' as she becomes the first Egyptian woman to play Olympic tennis for her country.

item.title: Pegasus: Who are the alleged victims of spyware targeting?
item.description: Jamal Khashoggi's wife and the editor of the Financial Times are among those said to be targeted.

item.title: The referee making Olympic history
item.description: The first Arab and African woman to referee 3x3 basketball at the Olympics shares how her Muslim faith has guided her career.

item.title: Olympics: Defying threats, Iranian athletes speak out to back ban
item.description: Olympics organisers are being urged to investigate allegations of threats, discrimination and abuse.

item.title: Islamic State children in Syria face a lifetime in prison
item.description: A BBC investigation found that children, whose parents supported IS, are caught in a conveyor belt of incarceration.

item.title: 'My husband was an angel - then he raped me'
item.description: Marital rape has long been a taboo issue in Egypt, but now victims are beginning to speak out.

item.title: The separated refugees brought back together by judo
item.description: Sanda Aldass and Muna Dahouk have trained together since childhood but the war in Syria separated them.

item.title: Deadly street protests over Iran water shortages
item.description: Khuzestan is one of the country's hottest regions, where temperatures can reach 50C.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: Hend Zaza, 12, is youngest athlete at Olympics
item.description: Hend Zaza from Syria reveals her inspiration for getting into table tennis at such a young age.

item.title: Covid-19 tests while you wait in Israeli airport
item.description: Ben Gurion airport in Israel has introduced fast Covid-19 tests for travellers.

item.title: Iraqi firefighters tackle blaze in Covid ward
item.description: More than 50 people have died after a fire broke out in a coronavirus isolation ward at a hospital in Iraq.
